DOC.brief_summary: This pilot feasibility trial evaluate Sinovuyo Caring Families Program small-scale randomize controlled trial Cape Town , South Africa ( n=60 family ) . The pilot study use mixed-methods approach intervention evaluation . Self-report observe quantitative data intervention control group collect pre-test post-test evaluation . Primary outcome include parent-reports observation child behavior problem . In addition , exploratory study , phase examine initial pre-post intervention effect potential mediating factor parent behavior , parental stress , parental depression , perceive social support . However , phase test mediation effect due small sample size . Quantitative assessment also collect data program fidelity , exposure/adherence , participant engagement , satisfaction . Furthermore , qualitative focus group intervention participant group leader examine issue program feasibility , content , deliver , satisfaction . Randomization do individual level include wait-list control group receive intervention 3 month post-test evaluation . Results feasibility pilot study share intervention partner advisory group . If necessary , final program adjustment make prior testing . Results also disseminate community forum , local organization , government stakeholder , via academic conference . Research hypotheses : Hypothesis 1 : Children intervention group demonstrate reduce observed parent-reported child behavior problem comparison control group . Hypothesis 2 : Parents intervention group demonstrate increase observed self-reported positive parenting outcome decrease observed self-reported harsh inconsistent parent outcome comparison control group . Hypothesis 3 : Parents intervention group demonstrate decrease parental depression parental stress outcome increase perceive social support outcome comparison control group . Hypothesis 4 : The Sinovuyo Caring Families Program implement acceptable degree program fidelity , exposure/adherence , participant satisfaction .
DOC.brief_title: Sinovuyo Caring Families Project - Pilot Trial
